availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Finn (Simpson County, KY, farmer & attorney)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer and attorney. Tennessee native. Married to Marie B. DuVal Finn in Robertson County, Tennessee, on January 28, 1845. Father of Mary C. Finn, Ella F. Finn, and John Finn. Married to M. Geraldine Moore Finn in Todd County on November 3, 1864. Farmer in Simpson County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Simpson County delegate to the Kentucky Democratic Convention in 1858. Attorney in Simpson County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860. Delegate to the Democratic National Convention representing the Third District of Kentucky for James Guthrie in 1860. Elector for Stephen A. Douglas in Kentucky's Third Congressional District in the presidential election of 1860. Attorney in Simpson County in 1864.
